News.Title: Delhivery Allots 2.30 Lakh Shares via ESOP Exercise
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited allotted 2,30,313 equity shares through employee stock option plan exercises across three ESOP schemes, increasing paid-up capital to Rs. 74,85,23,056.

News.Title: Delhivery to participate in Nuvama India Conference
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited announces participation in Nuvama 21st India Conference on February 9-10, 2026 in Mumbai for investor meetings under Regulation 30 compliance.

News.Title: Delhivery Targets Cost Reduction & Cash Flow Break-Even
News.Summary: Delhivery expects to reduce corporate costs to 6%-7% from 9.1% in Q3 FY26, targeting free cash flow break-even at 6% adjusted EBITDA margin as part of operational efficiency drive.

News.Title: Delhivery Maintains CAPEX Guidance, Projects Growth
News.Summary: Delhivery maintains CAPEX guidance with expectations to drop to 4%-4.4% over 7-10 quarters. Express parcel volume growth forecasted at 15%-20%, potentially exceeding 20%.

News.Title: Delhivery Independent Directors Resign
News.Summary: Delhivery announces resignation of Independent Directors Deepak Kapoor and Saugata Gupta as part of planned Board rejuvenation process, effective March-April 2026.

News.Title: Delhivery Q3FY26 Revenue Jumps 18% to ₹28,050 Million
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited reports strong Q3FY26 performance with revenue rising 18% YoY to ₹28,049.86 million and net profit of ₹395.89 million, despite exceptional items of ₹273.56 million.

News.Title: Delhivery Board Meet on Jan 31 for Q3FY26 Results
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited has scheduled a board meeting on January 31, 2026, to consider and approve Q3FY26 unaudited financial results. Trading window remains closed until February 2, 2026.

News.Title: Delhivery Launches AI-Powered Autonomous TMS Platform
News.Summary: Delhivery's TransportOne division unveils autonomous Transport Management System featuring AI agents that negotiate rates, plan shipments, and reconcile invoices to automate logistics operations.

News.Title: Delhivery Launches Financial Services Subsidiary
News.Summary: Delhivery has established a new subsidiary called 'Delhivery Financial Services Private Limited' following approval from the Ministry of Corporate Affairs, marking the logistics company's expansion into financial services.

News.Title: Delhivery Incorporates UK Subsidiary
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited announces the incorporation of Delhivery UK Limited on January 15, 2026, as a step-down wholly owned subsidiary through its Singapore entity, expanding its international presence.

News.Title: Delhivery Establishes UK Subsidiary for Expansion
News.Summary: Delhivery has established a wholly owned subsidiary in the UK named Delhivery UK Limited, which operates under Delhivery Singapore Pte. Ltd., marking the company's strategic expansion into the UK market.

News.Title: Delhivery Subsidiary Faces ₹16.39 Cr GST Demand
News.Summary: Spoton Logistics, Delhivery's subsidiary, receives GST appeal order imposing ₹16.39 crore tax demand for FY2017-18 to FY2021-22. Company states no material impact on operations.

News.Title: Delhivery Allots 1.97 Lakh Shares via ESOP Exercise
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited allotted 1,96,962 equity shares upon exercise of vested employee stock options across three ESOP schemes, raising ₹9.04 lakh and increasing paid-up capital to ₹74.83 crore.

News.Title: Delhivery Subsidiary Ecom Express Receives GST Order
News.Summary: Delhivery's subsidiary Ecom Express received a GST order for ₹3.55 crores including tax, interest and penalty for FY 2021-22. The company plans to file an appeal with no material impact expected.

News.Title: SBI Mutual Fund reduces stake in Delhivery by 2%
News.Summary: SBI Mutual Fund sold 18.18 lakh shares of Delhivery, reducing its shareholding from 5.93% to 5.69% of the logistics company's paid-up share capital as per regulatory disclosure.

News.Title: Delhivery Launches On-Demand Service in Mumbai & Hyderabad
News.Summary: Delhivery introduces on-demand delivery service in Mumbai and Hyderabad through its Delhivery Direct app, expanding its logistics capabilities in key metropolitan markets.

News.Title: Delhivery Launches International Economy Air Parcel Service for MSMEs
News.Summary: Delhivery launched Delhivery International, an Economy Air Parcel service designed to make global exports affordable and reliable for SMEs and enterprise customers across India. The service addresses high international shipping costs and complex documentation requirements through the Delhivery One platform, offering streamlined booking, real-time rates, and end-to-end visibility from pickup to delivery.

News.Title: Delhivery Allots 3.19 Lakh Equity Shares Upon Employee Stock Option Exercise
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited allotted 3,18,983 equity shares of face value Re. 1 each upon exercise of vested employee stock options across three ESOP schemes, realizing Rs. 6,11,983.70. The allotment increased the company's paid-up share capital from Rs. 74,77,76,798 to Rs. 74,80,95,781, with diluted earnings per share calculated at Re. 0.81 based on Q2FY26 earnings.

News.Title: Delhivery Successfully Tests Autonomous Logistics Drone in Deoria for Rural Connectivity
News.Summary: Delhivery conducted a successful test of an autonomous logistics drone in Deoria, demonstrating the company's technological capabilities in drone-based delivery systems. The test focuses on enhancing fast connectivity to rural areas in India, potentially expanding Delhivery's logistics reach to underserved markets.

News.Title: Delhivery Grants 1,50,700 Stock Options to Employees Under ESOP 2012
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited's Nomination and Remuneration Committee approved the grant of 1,50,700 stock options under its Employee Stock Option Plan 2012 to eligible employees on December 01, 2025. The options will vest over periods of 3-4 years with different vesting schedules, with each option convertible into one equity share of face value Re. 1 each.

News.Title: Delhivery Reports Strong Q2 Growth with 32% Express Volume Jump and Successful EcomExpress Integration
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited reported revenue from services of Rs. 2,546 crores for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, marking 16% year-over-year growth and 11% quarter-over-quarter growth. EBITDA reached Rs. 150 crores with a 5.9% margin, significantly up from Rs. 57 crores in the same quarter last year. Express parcel shipments grew 32.5% year-over-year to 246 million shipments, while PTL freight maintained steady growth at 477K tons. The company completed the EcomExpress acquisition in July 2025 for Rs. 1,369 crores, with integration costs of Rs. 90 crores in the quarter, well within the original Rs. 300 crore estimate. Express parcel margins stood at 15.3%, while PTL margins were at 8.5%. The company achieved record peak dispatch of 7.2 million orders in a single day during the festive season and crossed 100 million transportation orders in September. Cash and cash equivalents remained strong at Rs. 4,200 crores. Management indicated service EBITDA margins are expected to be in the 16-18% range by end of 2026.

News.Title: Delhivery Allots 1.22 Lakh Equity Shares Under Employee Stock Option Plans
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited's Stakeholders Relationship Committee approved the allotment of 1,22,840 equity shares of face value Re. 1 each upon exercise of vested stock options. The allotment includes 79,340 shares under ESOP 2012 and 43,500 shares under ESOP III 2020. The company realized Rs. 7,78,975 from the exercise of these options. Following this allotment, the paid-up share capital increased from Rs. 74,76,53,958 to Rs. 74,77,76,798. The diluted earnings per share stands at Re. 2.31 based on Q2 FY26 earnings. The newly allotted shares rank pari-passu with existing equity shares and are not subject to lock-in restrictions.

News.Title: Delhivery Shares Drop 6% on Quarterly Loss and CFO Leadership Change
News.Summary: Delhivery shares fell 6% to Rs 443.35 following the company's swing to a consolidated net loss of Rs 50.38 crore in the September quarter, compared to a profit of Rs 10.20 crore in the year-ago period. Revenue from operations rose 16.9% year-on-year to Rs 2,559.3 crore. The company reported record shipment volumes with Express Parcel shipments increasing 32% year-on-year to 246 million orders and Part-truckload volumes growing 12% to 477,000 metric tonnes. Integration costs related to the Ecom Express acquisition were Rs 90 crore during the quarter. Delhivery announced a CFO transition with Vivek Pabari taking over from Amit Agarwal effective January 1, 2026, as Agarwal steps down for personal reasons after 13 years with the company.

News.Title: Delhivery Approves Incorporation of Wholly Owned Financial Services Subsidiary
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited's Board of Directors approved the incorporation of a wholly owned subsidiary named Delhivery Financial Services Private Limited. The new entity will operate in the financial services sector, offering credit, payment, FASTag aggregator, fuel cards, and insurance solutions for partners including truckers, fleet owners, riders, and MSMEs. The subsidiary aims to function as a financial layer supporting Delhivery's logistics network by leveraging the company's data, reach, and partner ecosystem to enhance liquidity access and improve operational efficiency. Delhivery will invest up to INR 12 crores and hold 100% shareholding in the new subsidiary. The incorporation is subject to approval from relevant authorities including the Registrar of Companies.

News.Title: Delhivery Launches Freight Index One Platform to Bring Transparency to Indian Logistics Market
News.Summary: Delhivery launched Freight Index One, a platform providing historical, current, and forward Full Truckload pricing estimates for transporters, fleet owners, shippers, and logistics players across major trucking lanes in India. The service covers both open and closed container vehicle types. Rohan Anand, Head of Data Science at Delhivery, noted that India lacks equivalents to global indices like the Cass Freight Index and Freightos Baltic Index, creating routing issues and cost uncertainties. The platform uses nearly a decade of market intelligence and Delhivery's internal data, incorporating supply fluctuations, seasonality, route viability, and economic indicators including fuel prices, toll rates, and taxes. Kapil Bharati, Chief Technology Officer, stated the platform aims to enable efficient price benchmarking and help customers plan budgets using market-wide data. Industry participants can access the service at https://one.freightindex.in/. Delhivery operates across over 18,800 pincodes, has fulfilled over 3.6 billion shipments, and serves over 44,000 customers.

News.Title: Delhivery Submits Monitoring Agency Report for IPO Proceeds Utilization
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited submitted its monitoring agency report for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, prepared by Axis Bank Limited as the appointed monitoring agency. The report shows no deviation from the stated IPO objectives. The company's IPO, conducted from May 11-13, 2022, raised Rs. 52,350 million. During the quarter, Rs. 9,088.84 million was utilized for inorganic growth initiatives, funded from the current account and adjusted against matured fixed deposits. The total IPO proceeds of Rs. 38,863.03 million have been fully utilized across three main objectives: organic growth initiatives (Rs. 19,000 million), funding inorganic growth (Rs. 10,000 million), and general corporate purposes (Rs. 8,863.03 million). All funds allocated for general corporate purposes have been completely utilized with zero unutilized balance remaining.

News.Title: Delhivery CFO Amit Agarwal Resigns, Vivek Pabari Named Successor
News.Summary: Logistics services provider Delhivery announced the resignation of Chief Financial Officer Amit Agarwal, effective December 31, 2025, citing personal reasons. The company's board approved the appointment of Vivek Pabari as the new CFO, effective January 1, 2026. Additionally, non-executive Independent Director Aruna Sundararajan resigned from the board, effective January 1, 2026, following her appointment as a government nominee on a regulatory body. Sundararajan joined Delhivery's board in July 2022, and CEO Sahil Barua noted her contributions in strengthening governance and shaping strategy during the company's expansion period.

News.Title: Delhivery Independent Director Aruna Sundararajan Resigns Due to Government Appointment
News.Summary: Aruna Sundararajan has resigned from her position as Non-Executive Independent Director of Delhivery Limited, effective January 1, 2026. She cited her recent appointment as a Government nominee on a regulatory body and increased responsibilities as the reason for stepping down. Sundararajan will also resign from all Board committees where she served, including as Chairperson of the CSR Committee and member of the Audit Committee. She confirmed there are no other material reasons for her resignation beyond those mentioned. Sundararajan also holds independent director positions at L&T Technology Services Limited and National Bank for Financing Infrastructure and Development.

News.Title: Delhivery Board Approves Incorporation of Step-Down Subsidiaries in UK and UAE
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited's Board of Directors approved the incorporation of step-down wholly owned subsidiaries in the United Kingdom and United Arab Emirates. The subsidiaries will be owned by Delhivery Singapore Pte. Ltd., which is a wholly owned subsidiary of Delhivery Limited. Both entities will operate in the logistics business to provide supply chain solutions and logistics services. The company plans to invest up to INR 5 crore in each subsidiary through one or more tranches via 100% subscription to share capital in cash. The incorporation is subject to approval from competent authorities.

News.Title: Delhivery Reports Higher Q2 Net Loss Despite Revenue Growth
News.Summary: Delhivery reported a net loss of 504 million rupees in Q2, significantly higher than the 102 million rupees loss in the same period last year. Revenue grew to 25.59 billion rupees from 21.9 billion rupees year-over-year. EBITDA increased to 682 million rupees from 573 million rupees, with EBITDA margin slightly improving to 2.66% from 2.62%.

News.Title: Delhivery Reports Quarterly Results and Completes EcomExpress Acquisition
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited announced its unaudited financial results for the quarter and half year ended September 30, 2025. The Board of Directors approved the results at a meeting held on November 5, 2025. The company completed the acquisition of 99.87% of EcomExpress Limited's issued and paid-up share capital on a fully diluted basis for approximately Rs. 13,696.36 million, with EcomExpress becoming a subsidiary effective July 18, 2025. EcomExpress is described as an end-to-end technology-enabled logistics solutions provider. The acquisition resulted in goodwill of Rs. 9,691.48 million. During the quarter, Delhivery granted 965,410 stock options and 1,131,774 stock options were exercised. The company operates primarily in logistics services including warehousing, last-mile logistics, and supply chain consulting.

News.Title: Delhivery Launches Open Freight Index One to Boost Logistics Transparency
News.Summary: Delhivery has introduced the Open Freight Index One, a new initiative aimed at enhancing transparency within India's logistics sector.

News.Title: Delhivery Dissolves Bangladesh Subsidiary Operations
News.Summary: Delhivery has dissolved its subsidiary Delhivery Bangladesh Logistics. The logistics company has ceased operations of its Bangladesh-based unit.

News.Title: Delhivery Receives GST Demand Order Worth ₹49.2 Crore for Tax Rate Interpretation Issues
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited has received a demand order from the Joint Commissioner, CGST Commissionerate, Faridabad for ₹49,19,76,037 along with applicable interest and penalty equivalent to 100% of the tax demand. The order was passed under Section 74 of the CGST Act, 2017 for short payment or non-payment of GST on services due to tax rate interpretation issues. The demand pertains to services provided from FY 2018-19 to 2022-23 (up to July 2022) across various registrations of the company. The applicable GST rate on certain services has been disputed pursuant to the interpretation of tax rate notification. The company had raised the matter before GST Council through the Industry Forum in September 2024, seeking government clarification on applicable tax rate. Based on the company's assessment and prevailing law, Delhivery is hopeful of a favorable outcome at higher forums and does not expect it to have any material financial impact on the company.

News.Title: Delhivery Grants 274,450 Stock Options to Employees Under ESOP Plan
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited's Nomination and Remuneration Committee approved the grant of 274,450 stock options to eligible employees under the Delhivery Employees Stock Option Plan IV, 2021. Each stock option is convertible into one fully paid-up equity share with a face value of Re. 1. The options will vest over 4 years with 10% vesting after 12 months, 30% after 24 months, and the remaining 60% vesting at 15% every 6 months thereafter. The stock options can be exercised anytime from respective vesting dates until the employee continues employment with the company. The equity shares allotted upon exercise will not be subject to lock-in and will rank equally with existing equity shares.

News.Title: Delhivery Records Peak Delivery Volumes During October Festive Season
News.Summary: Delhivery achieved its highest delivery volumes during the second phase of the festive season in October. The logistics company reported record-breaking delivery numbers during this period.

News.Title: Delhivery Sees Rs. 198.92 Crore Block Trade on NSE
News.Summary: Delhivery Ltd. witnessed a block trade worth Rs. 198.92 crores on the National Stock Exchange. The transaction involved approximately 4,419,843 shares at a price of Rs. 450.05 per share.

News.Title: Delhivery Reports Strong September Performance with ₹19,500 Crore Shipment Value
News.Summary: Delhivery shipped goods worth ₹19,500 crore and processed over 104.4 million ecommerce and freight shipments in September. The logistics company achieved record daily metrics including serving 19,100 clients and fulfilling 6.2 million shipments in a single day. Notable deliveries included a five-minute delivery in Bengaluru and a 3,690-kilometer shipment from Gujarat to Mizoram. The company's shares gained over 2% following the business update. Delhivery plans to acquire Ecom Express for ₹1,407 crore, with CCI approval received for acquiring at least 99.44% stake. The company reported strong quarterly results with net profit rising 67% to ₹91 crore, revenue growing 6% to ₹2,294 crore, and EBITDA jumping 53% to ₹149 crore. Express parcel segment volumes grew 14% to 208 million shipments with revenue increasing 10% to ₹1,403 crore.

News.Title: Delhivery Sets New Delivery Records with 17.5 Million Packages in 24 Hours
News.Summary: Delhivery achieved record delivery performance in September 2025, processing 17.5 million packages within a 24-hour period and 6.2 million packages in a single day. The logistics company also recorded its fastest delivery time of 5 minutes in Bangalore during this period.

News.Title: Delhivery Shares Worth Rs. 63.88 Crores Traded in NSE Block Deal
News.Summary: Delhivery Ltd. witnessed a block trade on NSE involving approximately 1,489,278 shares at Rs. 428.90 per share, totaling Rs. 63.88 crores. The transaction represents a significant bulk deal in the logistics company's stock.

News.Title: Delhivery Reports Strong Q1 FY26 Results with 6% Revenue Growth and Improved Margins
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited delivered revenue from services of Rs. 2,294 crores in Q1 FY26, representing 6% year-on-year and 5% quarter-on-quarter growth. EBITDA margins expanded to 6.5% (Rs. 149 crores) from 4.5% in the same quarter last year. PAT reached Rs. 91 crores (nearly 4% margin), up from Rs. 54 crores in Q1 FY25. Express Parcel business showed strong performance with 208 million shipments (14% YoY growth) and revenues of Rs. 1,403 crores. The company completed its Ecom Express acquisition on July 18, 2025, for Rs. 1,369 crores after receiving Competition Commission approval. Volume retention from Ecom Express exceeded initial expectations of 30%, with the company retaining 55-65% of volumes. PTL business maintained stable performance with 458,000 tonnes of freight (15% YoY growth). Supply Chain services margins improved significantly from 2.2% to 7.2% following contract renegotiations and exit from unprofitable accounts. The company added two new board directors and announced the departure of a long-serving director.

News.Title: Delhivery Targets 35-40% E-Commerce Margins and 3X Asset Turnover
News.Summary: Delhivery expects its e-commerce margins to reach 35-40%, with potential for higher margins as network usage increases. The company aims to achieve 3X asset turnover for its Express Parcel and PTL businesses, improving from the current 2X level. Delhivery is targeting a return on capital of over 24%.

News.Title: Delhivery Projects Strong Growth Targets and Margin Improvements
News.Summary: Delhivery outlined its growth projections during an earnings call. The company's PTL (Part Truckload) division targets 20% annual growth in freight volume. Supply chain services revenue is projected to reach Rs. 1,800-2,000 crore by FY29. Express parcel margins are expected to remain in the 16-18% range. Corporate overheads are projected to decrease from the current 9.1% to 6-6.5%.

News.Title: Delhivery Reports 67% Jump in Q1 Net Profit to 910 Million Rupees
News.Summary: Delhivery reported quarterly consolidated net profit of 910 million rupees compared to 544 million rupees in the same period last year, marking a 67% year-on-year increase. Revenue grew to 22.94 billion rupees from 21.7 billion rupees, representing a 6% increase. EBITDA rose to 1.49 billion rupees from 971 million rupees, while EBITDA margin improved to 6.49% from 4.47% in the previous year.

News.Title: Delhivery Reports IPO Proceeds Utilization with Rs 9,089 Million Remaining Unutilized
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited submitted its monitoring agency report for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, detailing the utilization of proceeds from its Rs 52,350 million IPO conducted in May 2022. The report, prepared by Axis Bank Limited as the monitoring agency, shows no deviation from the stated objects. Out of net proceeds of Rs 38,863 million, the company has utilized Rs 29,774 million across various objectives. The company has fully utilized funds allocated for organic growth initiatives including building scale in existing business lines (Rs 1,600 million), expanding network infrastructure (Rs 13,600 million), and upgrading logistics operating systems (Rs 4,800 million). For general corporate purposes, Rs 8,863 million has been completely utilized. However, Rs 9,089 million remains unutilized from the Rs 10,000 million allocated for funding inorganic growth through acquisitions, with only Rs 911 million deployed so far. The unutilized proceeds of Rs 9,362 million are temporarily invested in fixed deposits with various banks, earning returns between 5.15% to 7.75%.

News.Title: Delhivery Appoints Two Independent Directors for Five-Year Terms
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited appointed Dr. Padmini Srinivasan and Mr. Yashish Dahiya as Additional Directors in the Independent Director category for five-year terms starting August 01, 2025. The appointments are subject to shareholder approval and run until July 31, 2030. Dr. Srinivasan is a faculty member and Chairperson at IIM Bangalore's Centre for Corporate Governance, holding a PhD and serving as a Board Member at BSE Ltd. Mr. Dahiya is Chairman & CEO of PB Fintech, founder of Policybazaar.com, and previously served as Managing Director of ebookers.com. Both directors are confirmed as not being debarred by SEBI or other authorities and are unrelated to existing company directors.

News.Title: Delhivery Reports Volume Growth in Latest Quarterly Results
News.Summary: Delhivery reported continued growth in volume during its quarterly results. The logistics company showed positive momentum in its core volume metrics.

News.Title: Delhivery Reports Strong Q1 FY26 Results with 67.5% Jump in Profit and Completes Ecom Express Acquisition
News.Summary: Delhivery Limited reported robust financial performance for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company achieved a profit after tax of ₹91 crores with a 3.8% margin, representing a 67.5% year-over-year increase from ₹54 crores in Q1 FY25. Total income grew 6.2% year-over-year to ₹2,424 crores, while revenue from services increased 5.6% to ₹2,294 crores. EBITDA improved significantly to ₹149 crores with a 6.5% margin, up from ₹97 crores and 4.5% margin in the previous year. The company demonstrated strong operational growth with Express Parcel shipments rising 13.6% year-over-year to 208 million and PTL freight tonnage increasing 14.7% to 458,000 tons. Delhivery completed its acquisition of Ecom Express on July 18, 2025, with a final purchase consideration of ₹1,369 crores after receiving regulatory approval. The company expanded its network infrastructure to 20.36 million square feet and increased its active customer base to 43,022. Fleet size grew to an average of 17,509 vehicles daily, while the team size reached 65,849 employees.

News.Title: Delhivery Reports Strong EBITDA Growth with Improved Margins
News.Summary: Delhivery reported quarterly EBITDA of 1.49 billion rupees compared to 971 million rupees in the same period last year. The company's EBITDA margin improved to 6.49% from 4.47% year-over-year, indicating enhanced operational efficiency and profitability.

News.Title: Delhivery Reports 67% Jump in Quarterly Net Profit to 910 Million Rupees
News.Summary: Delhivery posted a net profit of 910 million rupees in its latest quarterly results, marking a significant increase from 544 million rupees in the same period last year. The logistics company's revenue grew to 22.94 billion rupees compared to 21.7 billion rupees year-over-year.
